message.content:
cs.AR, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the formal specification of memory models in microprocessors, which falls under the category of computer architecture (cs.AR). The paper also discusses the need for reasoning about program behaviors and verifying compilers, which suggests a connection to programming languages (cs.PL). The use of timestamps and dynamic store buffers to capture the effect of instruction reordering suggests a connection to logic (cs.LO) and software engineering (cs.SE). Finally, the paper discusses the accuracy of the I2E models in capturing the behaviors of modern microarchitectures, which suggests a connection to cryptography and security (cs.CR).
